text: Eve was to have pains at childbirth because she

options.C: ate of the tree of life

text: Abram's obligation in his covenant with God was to

options.D: offer his son Isaac as a sacrifice

explanation:
InGenesis 17:1 (RSV),God made a covenant with Abram and commanded him:"I am God Almighty; walk before me, and be blameless."
Abram’s obligation in this covenant was tolive a righteous and faithful life in obedience to God.This was a condition for the blessings God promised, including making him the father of many nations.

text: God prepared Joseph for his leadership role in Egypt through

options.A: the love which his father had for him
options.B: the trials and temptations of his earlier years

explanation: God used the various trials Joseph faced, such as being sold into slavery by his brothers, his time in Potiphar's house and his imprisonment, to prepare him for his eventual leadership role in Egypt. These experiences developed his character, faith and leadership skills.

text: "....you brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?" The "wrath to come" here refers to the
According to Luke, the third temptation of Jesus was that He should

options.A: jump down from the high mountain
options.B: jump from the pinnacle of the temple
options.D: order the stone to become bread

explanation:
According to the book of Luke 4: 9-11, The third temptation of Jesus was when the Devil told Jesus to throw himself down from the top of the temple for God will give his angels charge over Jesus to stop him from falling.
Luke 4: 9 The devil led him to Jerusalem and had him stand on the highest point of the temple. “If you are the Son of God,” he said, “throw yourself down from here. 10 For it is written:
“‘He will command his angels concerning youto guard you carefully;11 they will lift you up in their hands,so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’

text: After the resurrection, the Early Church met to

options.A: determine how to deal with the Sanhendrin
options.B: plan the expansion of the church
options.C: appoint a replacement for Judas Iscariot
options.D: determine the Inclusion of the Gentiles in the church

explanation: After Jesus' resurrection and ascension into heaven, the Early Church met to find a replacement for Judas Iscariot. The apostles gathered together in Jerusalem, following Jesus' instructions, and chose Matthias to replace Judas Iscariot as one of the Twelve Apostles (Acts 1:12-24)

text: Paul in Thessalonian said the signs of the Second Coming of Christ would start with
explanation: When Paul wrote to the church of the Thessalonians, he made several references to the second coming of Christ, Paul told the Thessalonians that the second coming had not yet taken place. He reminds them of certain things concerning the nature of the second coming. Paul had taught them these things personally when he had been with them.
